meanings.definition: The quality of being made up of exactly similar parts facing each other or around an axis.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully studied the symmetries in the painting to ensure balance.
meanings.sent2: The butterfly's wings displayed beautiful symmetries in their patterns.
meanings.sent3: The cake's layers had such perfect symmetries that it looked almost too good to eat.
meanings.sent4: The symmetries in nature's design are a testament to its beauty and order.
meanings.sent5: The symmetries of the snowflakes were mesmerizing, each one unique yet perfectly balanced.

meanings.definition: Correspondence in size, shape, and relative position of parts on opposite sides of a dividing line or median plane or about a center or axis.
meanings.sent1: The architect ensured the symmetries of the building were flawless.
meanings.sent2: The mirror reflected perfect symmetries of the room's furniture.
meanings.sent3: The clown's costume had exaggerated symmetries that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The symmetries of the dance routine captivated the audience with its precision.
meanings.sent5: The symmetries of the flower petals created a harmonious and balanced display in the garden.
